step.cmd: Install the DNN JWT Auth Handler.

substep.cmd: In the Available Extensions tab, expand the Providerssection, search for DNN JWT Auth Handler, then click or tap its Install button.

image.alt: Available Extensions - Providers - DNN JWT Auth Handler - Install

stepresult.p: In your web.config file, the JWTAuth line is added inside the <messageHandlers/> tag.

step.cmd: Enable JWT authentication across all WEB API requests.

substep.cmd: Search for the newly-added JWTAuth line inside the <messageHandlers/> section of your web.config file.
Change JWTAuth's enabled and defaultInclude attributes to "true".

step.cmd: Enable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) to allow requests from remote Javascript clients.
step.info:
In your web.config file, add these access control lines inside the <customHeaders/> section.
<add name="Access-Control-Allow-Origin" value="*" /> <add name="Access-Control-Allow-Headers" value="accept, accept-language, content-type, accept, authorization, moduleid, tabid, x-dnn-moniker" /> <add name="Access-Control-Allow-Methds" value="GET, POST, PUT, HEAD, OPTIONS" />
note

step.cmd: Enable additional logging for advanced debugging.

info.p: In your DotNetNuke.log4net.config file, add the following logger lines after the </root> closing tag.
info.codeblock: <!-- The following is required to troubleshoot provider registration issues. --> <logger name="DotNetNuke.Web.Api.Auth"> <level value="TRACE" /> </logger> <!-- The following is required to troubleshoot failing WEB API calls. --> <logger name="DotNetNuke.Dnn.AuthServices.Jwt"> <level value="TRACE" /> </logger>
